body:
Looks like the exception is actually coming from pyreadline.

On 3 June 2013 06:37, codebraker notifications@github.com wrote:

> Hello,
> I have a pydev project for my test framework where in I connect to an
> industrial controller for my PLC application.
> I created an IPython interactive shell for troubleshooting with my
> framework modules and PLC logic.
> This interactive mode works fine when run on the computer. My objective is
> to generate an executable out of this using py2exe.
> 
> After generating the executable, the script fails at a point with the
> following error messages.
> 
> """
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [INFO ] connect.pyo 180: Switching to IPython
> interactive mode
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [INFO ] connect.pyo 181:
> 
> ---
> 
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [INFO ] connect.pyo 197:
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [INFO ] connect.pyo 203: Starting PyTAF's interactive
> mode
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [INFO ] connect.pyo 204: Hit [Ctrl+D] to exit
> interpreter and continue
> [Application] Could not copy README_STARTUP to startup dir. Source file
> D:\Softwares\Eclipse\Workspace-PyTAF\PyTAF\Executables\run_main\run_main.exe\IPython\config\profile\README_STARTUP
> does not exist.
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 94: Python exceptions occurred:
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: Traceback (most recent call
> last):
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File "run_main.py", line
> 66, in
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File "zipextimporter.pyo",
> line 82, in load_module
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File "comm\connect.pyo",
> line 205, in
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File
> "IPython\frontend\terminal\embed.pyo", line 282, in embed
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File
> "IPython\frontend\terminal\embed.pyo", line 97, in _init_
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File
> "IPython\frontend\terminal\interactiveshell.pyo", line 360, in _init_
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File
> "IPython\core\interactiveshell.pyo", line 455, in _init_
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File
> "IPython\core\interactiveshell.pyo", line 1785, in init_readline
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File "zipextimporter.pyo",
> line 82, in load_module
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File
> "IPython\utils\rlineimpl.pyo", line 33, in
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File "zipextimporter.pyo",
> line 82, in load_module
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File "readline.pyo", line
> 77, in
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: File
> "pyreadline\console\console.pyo", line 818, in install_readline
> 03.06.2013 10:41:57 [CRITICAL] run_main.py 98: TypeError: integer expected
> """
> 
> I am not sure how to solve this issue. Kindly help.
> If any more information is required to troubleshoot, pls let me know.
> 
> P.S. I want to distribute this executable to my colleagues who do not need
> IPython for their work. So they are not expected to install IPython on
> their machines.
> 
> Thanks.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/3394
> .

Hi takluyver, and others, 
yes it indeed. 
The pyreadline module actually tries to get process address using sys.dllhandle (also uses some ctypes functions). I could only get so far with debugging. 
I am not C programming guy so don't really know what to do further.. 
At least if I could understand what is pyreadline module and what it does?
Need some help here.

pyreadline is a Windows equivalent of the Unix 'readline' library, which
IPython uses for tab completion and history at the command prompt. You may
be able to leave it out - the Qt console and the notebook don't readline.
If you do need it, I can't help much with getting it to play nicely with
py2exe.

On 4 June 2013 01:40, codebraker notifications@github.com wrote:

> Hi takluyver, and others,
> yes it indeed.
> The pyreadline module actually tries to get process address using
> sys.dllhandle (also uses some ctypes functions). I could only get so far
> with debugging.
> I am not C programming guy so don't really know what to do further..
> At least if I could understand what is pyreadline module and what it does?
> Need some help here.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/3394#issuecomment-18882748
> .

appreciate your help Thomas. Thanks for the info. 
I think I will require the readline module considering the benefits it offers (which you mentioned). For the interactive mode with my framework these features will be handy since I am having a console based application.
need some more knowledge on this issue...

Hello folks,
can some one guide me with this issue?
@jstenar might know something useful, he maintains pyreadline. The rest of us mostly don't use Windows, so we can't help much.
Closing this, as I don't think there's anything to actually fix in IPython. @jstenar may be able to help with pyreadline difficulties.
